page.title: 16BRATTLEBY
page.content: Brattleby is a hamlet with a population of 69. There is no shop, public house or garage, but a very old stone church still regularly used. In this village lives the Rev. Denzil Wright who was born in 1907. He has been a resident of Brattleby all his life and remembers, when he was only four the coronation of George V. As part of the celebration a fair was held at the nearby village of Ingham. The village has changed very little during those 78 years. Most of the houses are made of limestone dug out of the hill in Brattleby and are between a hundred and two hundred years old. A few dwellings have been built recently. In the early Domesday book it is reported that the Bishop of Durham owned much of the land in Brattleby and the church was named St. Cuthbert in connection with Durham.
